item.title: "[detla] Unmute Command [317]
item.dc:creator: @BitchPk BitchPk
item.description:
@BitchPk wrote:

heey i got a problem none of us staff can unmute a player by doing ::unmute i have to go into files :s

how do i fix this??
cuz evrytieme ido ::unmute it sayds you tried to unmute the player or something

my mute file is in config ( idk if u guys needed to know this )

here is my ::mute command

[code] if (command.startsWith(“mute”) && playerRights >= 1) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(5);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);
if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“mod nick”)) {
sM(“You have abused this, you can’t ban anyone!”);
} else {
if (otherPIndex != -1) {
client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];
if(playerRights <= p.playerRights) {
sM(“You can’t mute anyone of the same rank or higher than you!”);
} else if(playerRights > p.playerRights) {
p.muted = true;
writeLog(p.playerName, “mutes”);
sM(“You have muted “+p.playerName+”!”);
yell("["+playerName+"] has just Muted “+p.playerName+”!");
}

                } else { 
                   sM("The name doesnt exist."); 
                }
}
            } catch (Exception e) { 
                sM("Try entering a name you want to mute..");
            }
        }[/code]

and here is my ::unmute command

if(command.startsWith("unmute") && playerRights >= 1) { String name = command.substring(7); unmuteuser(name); }

Read full topic
